subject: Career
title: Warmth vs. Competence
description: Learn Warmth vs. Competence in one minute.

hook.text: Harvard psychologist Amy Cuddy found we judge people on two axes: warmth and competence.

buildup.text: Warmth comes first â€” can I trust this person? Competence follows â€” can they do the job?

discovery.text: Leading with competence alone makes you seem cold. Leading with warmth opens the door.

twist.text: But warmth without competence signals 'nice but not capable.' You need both in sequence.

climax.text: Start friendly and genuine. Then demonstrate your expertise. Trust first, proof second.

punchline.text: Be liked first. Be impressive second.

quiz.question: According to Amy Cuddy, which trait do people judge first?
